## Week 1
  - Lectrue: Review of likelihood inference and asymptotic results

<br>

## Week 2
  - Lecture: The likelihood family: Marginal, conditional, profile, quasi, empirical, etc. 
  - Discussion of [Likelihood Inference](https://utstat.toronto.edu/reid/research/likelihood-final.pdf) by Nancy Reid

<br>

## Week 3
  - Lecture: Likelihood inference (i) under model misspecification and (ii) with missing data
  - Discussion of (1) [You want me to analyze data I don't have? Are you insane?](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4198883/) by Xiao-Li Meng and (2) [Maximum likelihood estimation with missing outcomes: From simplicity to complexity](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6879193/) by Stuart Baker

<br>

## Week 4
  - Lecture: High-dimensional likelihood inference 
  - Discussion of [A modern maximum-likelihood theory for high-dimensional logistic regression](https://www-pnas-org.myaccess.library.utoronto.ca/doi/pdf/10.1073/pnas.1810420116) by Pragya Sur and Emmanuel J. Cand√®s
